verses.text: 猶太人獨特的地方這樣說來，猶太人獨特的地方在哪裡呢？割禮又有甚麼益處呢？

words.note: Lit. 'people of Judea'
A key religious ritual in Judaism.

verses.text: 從各方面來說，的確很多。最重要的，是 神的聖言已經託付了他們。

words.note: Often preceded by a full-width space '　' in Bibles for reverence.
More formal than everyday 'jiao gei'.

verses.text: 即使有人不信，又有甚麼關係呢？難道他們的不信會使 神的信實無效嗎？

words.note: Used to pose a rhetorical question, expecting a negative answer.
A key attribute of God in the Bible.

verses.text: 絕不可能！ 神總是誠實的，人卻是虛謊的，正如經上所記：「你在話語上，顯為公義；你被論斷時，必然得勝。」

words.note: Often indicates the object of a verb or a passive construction.

words.definition: to appear as, to be shown to be

words.note: A core theological concept of God's character.

verses.text: 我且照著人的見解來說，我們的不義若彰顯 神的義，我們可以說甚麼呢？難道降怒的 神是不義的嗎？

words.note: Here, it implies 'let's just (say for argument's sake)'

words.definition: to speak of, in terms of

words.note: A core theological concept.
Formal equivalent of '如果'.
A core theological concept.
Refers to God's judgment or punishment.

verses.text: 絕對不是！如果是這樣， 神怎能審判世界呢？

words.note: Refers to God; capitalized in English Bibles.

verses.text: 但是 神的誠實，如果因我的虛謊而更加顯出他的榮耀來，為甚麼我還要像罪人一樣受審判呢？

words.note: Refers to God; capitalized in English Bibles.
Often used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 為甚麼不說：「我們去作惡以成善吧！」這種人被定罪是理所當然的。

words.definition: in order to, so as to
as it should be, proper, deserved

verses.text: 世上一個義人也沒有那又怎麼樣呢？我們比他們強嗎？絕不是的。因為我們已經控訴過，無論是猶太人或是希臘人，都在罪惡之下，

words.note: Refers to the Jewish people.
Refers to the Greek people.

verses.text: 正如經上所說：「沒有義人，連一個也沒有，
沒有明白的，沒有尋求 神的；

words.note: The space before 神 is a traditional honorific.

verses.text: 人人都偏離了正道，一同變成污穢；沒有行善的，連一個也沒有。
他們的喉嚨是敞開的墳墓，他們用舌頭弄詭詐，他們嘴裡有虺蛇的毒，
滿口是咒罵和惡毒；
為了殺人流血，他們的腳步飛快，
在經過的路上留下毀滅和悲慘。
和睦之道，他們不曉得，

words.note: A more formal or literary way of saying 'the way of'.
Common in older texts, used frequently in the Bible.

verses.text: 他們的眼中也不怕 神。」

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence, common in Bible translations.

verses.text: 然而我們曉得，凡律法所說的，都是對在律法之下的人說的，好讓每一個人都沒有話可講，使全世界的人都伏在 神的審判之下。

words.note: Common in older texts, used frequently in the Bible.
The preceding space indicates reverence, common in Bible translations.

verses.text: 沒有一個人可以靠行律法，在 神面前得稱為義，因為藉著律法，人對於罪才有充分的認識。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence, common in Bible translations.
Indicates possibility or outcome, similar to 'can' or 'to obtain'.

verses.text: 因信基督白白稱義現在，有律法和先知的話可以證明： 神的義在律法之外已經顯明出來，

words.note: Lit. 'declare righteous'
Lit. 'one who knows first'
The leading space indicates reverence in some Bible editions.
Directional complement indicating emergence.

verses.text: 就是 神的義，因著信耶穌基督，毫無區別地臨到所有信的人。

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence in some Bible editions.

words.definition: without any, not in the least

verses.text: 因為人人都犯了罪，虧缺了 神的榮耀，

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence in some Bible editions.

verses.text: 但他們卻因著 神的恩典，藉著在基督耶穌裡的救贖，就白白地稱義。

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence in some Bible editions.
Lit. 'declare righteous'

verses.text: 神設立了耶穌為贖罪祭（「贖罪祭」直譯作「贖罪或使 神息怒之法」），是憑著他的血，藉著人的信，為的是要顯明 神的義；因為 神用忍耐的心寬容了人從前所犯的罪，

words.note: Lit. 'redeeming sin sacrifice'
The leading space indicates reverence in some Bible editions.
The leading space indicates reverence in some Bible editions.

verses.text: 好在現今顯明他的義，使人知道他自己為義，又稱信耶穌的人為義。

words.note: Used to introduce a purpose or result, similar to 'in order that'.

verses.text: 這樣，有甚麼可誇的呢？沒有可誇的了。憑甚麼準則說沒有的呢？憑行為嗎？不是的，而是以信心為準則說的。

words.note: Often used in biblical context for 'reason to boast'.
In theological context, refers to 'works of the law'.

verses.text: 因為我們認定，人稱義是由於信，並不是靠行律法。

words.note: A key theological term for being declared righteous by God.

verses.text: 難道 神只是猶太人的 神嗎？不也是外族人的 神嗎？是的，他也是外族人的 神。

words.note: Implies a negative answer is expected, 'Could it be that...?'
Refers to the Jewish people.
Refers to non-Jewish people.

verses.text: 神既然只有一位，他就以信為準則稱受割禮的為義，也要以信為準則稱沒有受割禮的為義。

words.note: Lit. 'receive circumcision'; often refers to the circumcised.
Lit. 'not receive circumcision'; often refers to the uncircumcised.

verses.text: 這樣說來，我們以信廢掉了律法嗎？絕對不是，倒是鞏固了律法。

words.note: Used to introduce a conclusion or summary.
Refers to the theological concept of 'faith'.
Often refers to the Mosaic Law in biblical context.
Used to express an unexpected or contrasting outcome.
Often refers to the Mosaic Law in biblical context.
